sentences.english: This book is suffused with Shaw's characteristic wry Irish humour.
sentences.chinese: 这本书充满了萧伯纳独特的爱尔兰式幽默与嘲讽。

sentences.english: His mouth continued to twitch unspeaking in nervous curls of disdain.
sentences.chinese: 嘴唇却一个劲儿地抽搐着，显示出神经质的嘲讽。

sentences.english: In this tone of contempt, or sarcasm, it’s weird.
sentences.chinese: 他那个腔调又是轻蔑又是嘲讽，真是奇怪。

sentences.english: He was easy game for satirists.
sentences.chinese: 他是讽刺作家嘲讽的对象。

sentences.english: Let not the sword-knife mock its hperdle for being dull.
sentences.chinese: 不要让刀锋嘲讽它柄子的拙钝。

sentences.english: It was the final irony of Missy's life.
sentences.chinese: 这是对米丝一生的最后嘲讽。

sentences.english: She made the mistake of smiling mockingly, saw his fist draw back.
sentences.chinese: 看到他的拳头撤回去，她犯了个错误，嘲讽地微笑着。

sentences.english: The style Shelley is using here is that of popular lampoon .
sentences.chinese: 这里雪莱用的是通俗的嘲讽手法。

sentences.english: Kippers are one of those quintessentially English foods that leave us open for mockery.
sentences.chinese: 这种腌鱼使得我们不去嘲讽英国的食品。

sentences.english: No longer were his lectures greeted with sneers and catcalls.
sentences.chinese: 他的课不再遭到嘲讽和“嘘嘘”的起哄声。

sentences.english: Every nation ridicules other nations, and all are right.
sentences.chinese: 每一个国家都嘲讽别的国家，而大家都没错。

sentences.english: The insurgents' cartridges were giving out; but not their sarcasms .
sentences.chinese: 被包围者的子弹逐渐耗尽，他们的嘲讽却还没有枯竭。

sentences.english: He cried again because of my sarcasm.
sentences.chinese: 由于我的嘲讽，他又哭了。

sentences.english: Inveighing and mocking won't solve any problem.
sentences.chinese: 谩骂嘲讽能解决什么问题？

sentences.english: There are numerous examples throughout history of independent thinkers who were cast out and scorned by society.
sentences.chinese: 历史上独立思想家被驱逐或嘲讽的例子并非罕见。

sentences.english: His taunts stung me to action.

definition: to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
to mock oneself/to laugh at oneself
